title: MAFS' Jessika Power reveals how much she makes on Instagram as an influencer per week
text:
As the old saying goes, 'There's no such thing as bad publicity.'

And that mantra is certainly true for Married At First Sight 'villain' Jessika Power, who is making plenty of cash through sponsored Instagram posts.

The 28-year-old, who infamously cheated on her MAFS 'husband' with another groom, told Daily Mail Australia she is making between $8,000 and $10,000 per week as a social media influencer.

Revealed: The staggering amount of money Jessika Power earns per WEEK as an Instagram influencer (and it will make you want to quit your job and sign up for Married At First Sight)

While her weekly income can vary, Jessika has a regular stream of clients willing to pay her thousands just to share a post or Story with her 215,000 followers.

In recent months, she has promoted everything from teeth whitening devices and sex toys to skincare products, restaurants and cosmetic clinics.

In addition to this, Jessika has also started doing personal appearances at events, where she can make several thousand dollars for just a few hours of work.

Cashing in! While her income can vary, Jessika is making between $8,000 and $10,000 per week as a social media influencer

A walking advertisement! In recent months, Jessika has promoted everything from teeth whitening devices and sex toys to skincare products, restaurants and cosmetic clinics

In November, Jessika will attend the annual school leavers' 'Schoolies' celebration on the Gold Coast alongside Geordie Shore star Scotty T.

Earlier this month, she flew to Cairns to host several 'Mad Monday' events, where excited locals flocked to take selfies with her.

Despite her steady income from social media, Jessika said she wants to 'focus more on a career away from Instagram and [find a] permanent job.'

Moneybags! In addition to this, Jessika has also started doing personal appearances at events, where she can make several thousand dollars for just a few hours of work

In September, Jessika and professional boxer Anthony Mundine used Brisbane's Hit105 studios to record a pilot episode for a potential radio program.

According to industry sources, the pair were being tested for their own breakfast show with the Hit Network.

Daily Mail Australia understands the first recording exceeded expectations, but there is 'still some work to do' before things move forward.

The new Jackie O? In September, Jessika and professional boxer Anthony Mundine used Brisbane's Hit105 studios to record a pilot episode for a potential radio program
description: As the old saying goes, 'There's no such thing as bad publicity.'
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
